intro: Paramesus nervulosus, commonly known as the narrow-veined paramesus, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves with prominent veins. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and numerous stamens. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical habitats.
